title: SL’s e-commerce rules still playing catch-up
byline: Sri Lanka’s fast-expanding e-commerce sector is currently operating in a policy vacuum as critical regulatory gaps undermine consumer protection, transparency, and trust in the digital marketplace.

title: Local tourism earnings clouded by outdated accounting, says  Sri Lanka Tourism Alliance
byline: The local tourism industry, once hailed as the country’s third-largest foreign exchange earner, is under scrutiny for the reliability of its earnings data, with experts warning that flawed accounting methods are distorting the true picture of the sector’s performance.

title: Australian education partnerships hailed as blueprint for Sri Lanka’s future economy
byline: Australian education has become one of the most powerful and enduring links in its bilateral relationship with Sri Lanka, emerging as a critical pillar for building the advanced skills and capabilities that will define the nation’s future economy.

title: Bhagwanthalawa three-wheelers registered and issued ID stickers
byline: All hired and private three-wheelers, including those used by estate workers in Bhagwanthalawa, were registered and issued special identification stickers at the Bhagwanthalawa Police Station on November 5.

title: Sri Lanka begins process to list national heritage sites, draft new laws
byline: The National Heritage Division of the Ministry of Cultural Affairs has initiated the process of identifying and listing Sri Lanka’s national heritage sites, along with drafting new legislation to protect them.

title: Vatican Foreign Minister meets Prime Minister at Temple Trees
byline: His Excellency Archbishop Paul Richard Gallagher, Secretary for the Holy See’s Relations with States and International Organizations (Foreign Minister of the Vatican), paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at Temple Trees on Monday.

title: Dr. Saman Weerasinghe honoured with Russia’s Prestigious Order of Friendship
byline: Dr. Saman Weerasinghe has been awarded the Order of Friendship (Orden Druzhby) by Russian President Vladimir Putin at a ceremony held at the Kremlin in Moscow.

title: Health Minister meets WFP officials to discuss food and nutrition security
byline: The World Food Programme (WFP) Country Representative Philip Ward and Government Partnership Officer Mustafa Nihmath met Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa at the Ministry of Health on Monday (4).

title: Cannabis cultivation only for export; no possibility of entering into local market: Minister
byline: In the wake of controversy over the cannabis cultivation project, Cabinet Spokesman Health Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday cannabis cultivation is done in investment zones solely for export purposes.

title: AMS condemns manipulation in Health Ministry’s 2026 End Post List
byline: The Association of Medical Specialists (AMS) has raised serious concerns over an alleged attempt by a senior Health Ministry official to include two additional posts in the finalized Medical Specialists End Post List for 2026.

title: Much more to be done to eradicate underworld: SF
byline: There is much more to be done in order to eradicate the underworld, former MP Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka said today.

title: Over 40% of migrants move to Colombo and Gampaha due to marriage
byline: Among the more than three million district-wise migrant population, 40.6 percent moved to Colombo (16.7%) and Gampaha (16.8%) districts due to marriage, according to the latest report by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Ugandan born American Zohran Mamdani elected as the New York Mayor
byline: In a milestone for representation and grassroots politics, Zohran Mamdani has been elected Mayor of New York City — becoming the first Ugandan-born American to lead the nation’s largest city.

title: Sajith Premadasa meets Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa met with Om Birla, Speaker of the Lok Sabha, for a productive discussion focused on deepening parliamentary cooperation and sharing procedural best practices.

title: Do we really need the opposition to protest right now?
byline: The opposition has announced a major rally on November 21, as a first warning to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, demanding that he fulfills the election pledges made to the nation. They say the protest is also to oppose any attempts to suppress opposition parties.

title: Applications open for 10th intake of interest-free student loan scheme
byline: The Education Ministry  has opened applications for the 10th intake of the Interest-Free Student Loan Scheme (IFSL), offering thousands of students the opportunity to pursue degree programmes at recognized non-state higher education institutes.

title: Rise in drug addiction among women in Colombo: Ministry
byline: The Children and Women’s Affairs Ministry has raised serious concern over a rapid increase in the number of women addicted to drugs in Colombo and nearby cities.

title: Is Sri Lanka in the dark if tsunami strikes again?
byline: Amidst the Tsunami Exercise (IOWave25) scheduled in several coastal districts today, Director General of the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) Maj. Gen. Sampath Kotuwegoda (Retd.) yesterday revealed that all 77 Tsunami Early Warning Towers in the country are not operative at the moment.

title: At least three killed after UPS plane crashes in Kentucky, erupts into ball of fire
byline: At least three people were killed and 11 injured after a UPS (UPS.N), opens new tab wide-body cargo plane crashed in Louisville, Kentucky, erupting into a massive fireball shortly after takeoff, Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear said on Tuesday.

title: Tea factory worker dies after being trapped in machine
byline: A worker at the Maussakele Tea Factory, operated by the Maskeliya Plantation Company, died after being trapped in a tea processing machine in the early hours of yesterday morning.

title: NPP PS member arrested for threatening Hingurakgoda police
byline: A member of the National People’s Power (NPP) representing the Hingurakgoda Pradeshiya Sabha (PS) was arrested last night (4) for allegedly threatening police officers and using criminal force inside the Hingurakgoda Police Station in an attempt to secure the release of his brother.

title: 8th China international import expo opens in Shanghai
byline: The latest edition of the China International Import Expo (CIIE), the world’s first national-level exposition dedicated to imports, opened on Wednesday in Shanghai.

title: 10 arrested at Facebook-organised drug party
byline: Ten youths, including a woman were arrested during a raid on a hotel party organised through Facebook at Galkanuwa Road, Gorakana in Keselwatte.

title: Four drown in Deruru Oya
byline: Four individuals were reported missing from among a group of ten who were bathing near the Deduru Oya Bridge this afternoon.

title: NPP councillor’s husband arrested with heroin
byline: A principal of a primary school in the Eppawala area of Anuradhapura has been arrested for alleged involvement in heroin trafficking, police said.

title: Ex-Zimbabwe cricket captain Williams treated for 'drug addiction'
byline: Former Zimbabwe captain Sean Williams is being treated for drug addiction and will not play for the country again, the national cricket board said on Tuesday.

title: Mohammad Ashraful Appointed as Bangladesh Batting Coach
byline: Former Bangladesh player Mohammad Ashraful has been appointed as the national batting coach ahead of the upcoming home series against Ireland.

title: Only one player under 30 in Australia Ashes squad
byline: Australia chief selector George Bailey says the squad for the first Ashes Test against England deserves ’’respect’’ following criticism of the age of players.

title: NPP PS member who threatened police gets bail
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) Hingurakgoda Pradeshiya Sabha member, who was arrested for allegedly threatening police officers, was released on bail by Hingurakgoda Magistrate Duminda Karunarathne today.

title: Indian FM S. Jaishankar assures India’s support for Sri Lanka’s stability
byline: The Indian Minister of Foreign Affairs S. Jaishankar reaffirmed India’s continued support to Sri Lanka in maintaining political and economic stability.

title: Pakistan’s Rauf and Indian skipper Yadav punished over Asia Cup behaviour
byline: Pakistan paceman Haris Rauf and Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav were punished by the International Cricket Council (ICC) on Tuesday for their inflammatory behaviour in September’s Asia Cup.

title: Liverpool defeat Real Madrid in Champions League after Mac Allister goal
byline: Alexis Mac Allister scores a second-half winner after Courtois makes a string of fine saves to deny Liverpool.
